title: Adding a decorator causes bytecode error
body:
### Describe the bug

I tried to add a decorator for a JPA repository component. Simple project to reproduce the problem is attached 

I have created alternative implementation of GameRepository that is not based on JPA and without @Transactional. It works perfectly.


### Expected behavior

There should be no bytecode error and the decorator method should be executed

### Actual behavior

When the JpaGameRepositoryTest is run the following exception is thrown:

pl.kurs.JpaGameRepositoryTest#add(JpaGameRepositoryTest.java:19) JpaGameRepositoryTest#add() Method expects a return value
Exception Details:
  Location:
    pl/kurs/JpaGameRepository_Subclass$$function$$1.apply(Ljava/lang/Object;Ljava/lang/Object;)Ljava/lang/Object; @26: return
  Reason:
    Error exists in the bytecode
  Bytecode:
    0000000: 2cc0 000c b900 1001 0003 324e 2ab4 0012
    0000010: c000 142d c000 16b6 001a b1


### How to Reproduce?

Run tests for attached project
[decorator.zip](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/files/13960004/decorator.zip)

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

_No response_

### Output of `java -version`

openjdk 21 2023-09-19 OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 21+35-2513) OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM (build 21+35-2513, mixed mode, sharing)

### Quarkus version or git rev

_No response_

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

Java version: 21, vendor: Oracle Corporation, runtime: D:\DevTools\Java\jdk-21 Default locale: en_US, platform encoding: UTF-8 OS name: "windows 10", version: "10.0", arch: "amd64", family: "windows"

### Additional information

_No response_
